articles.author: JASON DEAREN, MICHELLE R. SMITH and AARON KESSLER
articles.description: MOUNT OLIVE, N.C. (AP) — The U.S. military trained him in explosives and battlefield tactics. Now the Iraq War veteran and enlisted National Guard member was calling for taking up arms against police and government officials in his own country.
articles.title: His country trained him to fight. Then he turned against it. More like him are doing the same

articles.author: CAROLYN THOMPSON, JEFF AMY and CALVIN WOODWARD
articles.description: Shortly after taking the stage 91 minutes late for his Atlanta rally this week, Donald Trump did what he can't help doing — go off on a tangent. This was clearly going to be a night at the improv.
articles.title: Harris and Trump say America tanks if they lose. So why the exuberance at their rallies?

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: MILWAUKEE (AP) — With three weeks left in the presidential campaign, Democrat Kamala Harris is spending most of her days trying to shore up support in the “blue wall” states of Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin as she tries to avoid a repeat of Hillary Clinton’s collapse there eight years ago.
articles.title: With time running out, Harris keeps focus on 'blue wall' states

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. military unleashed B-2 stealth bombers to target underground bunkers used by Yemen’s Houthi rebels early Thursday, a major escalation in the American response to the rebels' attacks on Mideast shipping lanes that appeared to be a warning to Iran as well.
articles.title: US long-range B-2 stealth bombers target underground bunkers of Yemen's Houthi rebels

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Syria’s military says Israel wounded two civilians and damaged a military post a strike early Thursday in the coastal city of Latakia, about 100 kilometers (60 miles) north of the Lebanese border.
articles.title: Middle East latest: An Israeli strike wounds 2 civilians, Syrian military says

articles.author: LORNE COOK, MIKE CORDER and RAF CASERT
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Thursday that support from his embattled nation's Western allies is key to his “ victory plan ” to end the country's devastating war with Russia as he laid out details of the plan to European Union leaders.
articles.title: Ukrainian president Zelenskyy heads to EU and NATO to seek backing for his 'victory plan'

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE and KAITLYN HUAMANI
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — Shockwaves spread around the world Thursday at the death of Liam Payne, who shot to stardom as a member of British boy band One Direction and had to deal with intense global fame while still in his teens.
articles.title: Death of ex-One Direction member Liam Payne at 31 sends shockwaves around the world

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Mitch McConnell said after the 2020 election that then-President Donald Trump was “stupid as well as being ill-tempered," a “despicable human being" and a “narcissist,” according to excerpts from a new biography of the Senate Republican leader that will be released this month.
articles.title: McConnell called Trump 'stupid" and 'despicable' in private after the 2020 election, a new book says

articles.author: COLLIN BINKLEY
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A student loan cancellation program for public workers has granted relief to more than 1 million Americans — up from just 7,000 who were approved before it was updated by the Biden administration two years ago.
articles.title: The Biden administration has now canceled loans for more than 1 million public workers

articles.author: LEA SKENE
articles.description: TURNER STATION, Md. (AP) — As the dust settled after the deadly collapse of Baltimore’s Francis Scott Key Bridge, as the initial shock wore off and the breaking news coverage subsided, residents of this tiny peninsula found themselves facing an uncertain future.
articles.title: A historically Black community grapples with lasting impacts after Baltimore bridge collapse
